citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
**A review of records at the time of inspection indicated the attending veterinarian had not visited the facility since 2019.
The licensee indicated the animals are taken to the veterinary clinic for routine visits, however, no regularly scheduled
visits had been made by the attending veterinarian since 2019. The attending veterinarian should review the written
program of veterinary care in addition to performing regularly scheduled visits to the facility in order to ensure the health
and well-being of the animals according to established veterinary standards.
Correct by November 27, 2023

**There was no written contingency plan available for review at the time of inspection. Written documentation of the
contingency plan should be maintained and reviewed on an annual basis in order to provide for the humane handling and
care of the animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Contingency plans and any applicable documentation
should be available to APHIS representatives during the unannounced inspections.
Correct by December 8, 2023
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by (January 08, 2024)-60 days counted from 1st RL
Inspection or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to
schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
**A review of records at the time of inspection indicated the attending veterinarian  had not visited the facility since 2019. 
The licensee indicated the animals are taken to the veterinary clinic for routine visits, however,  no regularly scheduled 
visits had been made by the attending veterinarian  since 2019. The attending veterinarian  should review  the written 
program of veterinary care in addition to performing  regularly scheduled visits to the facility in order to ensure the health 
and well-being of the animals according to established veterinary standards. 
 
Correct by November  27, 2023 
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
**There was no written contingency plan available for review  at the time of inspection. Written documentation of the 
contingency plan should be maintained and reviewed  on an annual basis in order to provide for the humane handling and 
care of the animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Contingency plans and any applicable documentation 
should be available to APHIS representatives  during the unannounced  inspections. 
 
Correct by December 8, 2023 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by (January 08, 2024)-60 days counted from 1st RL 
Inspection or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to 
schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

n
